column4: my USB modem is not working anymore ......ICON 225 on Jaunty > any help for this issue please ???
did you try googling the same issue? if not try that,,you might get some help out there
done this and found out something on the net except that they say if kernel bigger then 2.6 I should use the driver on the kernel ...which is not working :d
if you can't do that be more specific and let me google it
whats the kernel version you're having? it says the driver is working fine for 2.6.27
btw, as a last resort you have to compile it from source..did you try that ?
in that case may be we need to compile it from source right?
wasn't sure if I'm not going to screw something else :d so I didn't
we're going to compile just that module only, do you have other dependencies on that which might break if there are some issues during compilation?
> well ...you tell me :d should I try this or not ? could it be more damaging for the network manager for example ????
the links you gave me talks about compiling from src in depth...so i think you can easily follow that, right?
its segregated...no impact on others..try it out...it shud work...but make sure you follow the steps religiously
: only that I wanted to check that first ....and not to jump on the process
still stuck? ....i hope not....gotta go...c ya
